articles.title: Across the aisle by P Chidambaram: Many perspectives, one conclusion
articles.description: In a developing country, a measure of the government’s success is its capacity to build quality infrastructure and create quality jobs. While the quantity of infrastructure built in the last decade has been large (and the amounts spent colossal), the quality has been appalling — obsolete design and technology, falling bridges, collapsing buildings, and new highways that are washed away after the first rain. On quality jobs, the less said the better
articles.content: At age 93 (bless him), Dr C Rangarajan is an indefatigable campaigner for an open economy and prudent fiscal management. He was a central banker for many years and the 19th governor of the Reserve Bank of India (1992-97). On October 14, 2025, he co-a... [4583 chars]

articles.title: Augmented-reality app allows Penguin Court visitors to 'see' former Scaife mansion
articles.description: The 50-room mansion at Penguin Court in Laughlintown was demolished shortly after the death of former Tribune-Review publisher Richard Scaife’s parents, Alan Scaife and Sarah Mellon. But thanks to modern technology and the work of Murrys­ville artist Christopher Ruane, visitors to the 923-acre estate can look at their mobile devices

articles.title: Regulation on deepfakes soon, two semiconductor units operational now: Vaishnaw
articles.description:
The Government is going to bring a regulation on deepfakes soon that will take help of technology for efficient implementation, Union electronics and IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Saturday.
Speaking at a private event, the minister said that chips are key for building AI infrastructure and
articles.content: The Government is going to bring a regulation on deepfakes soon that will take the help of technology for efficient implementation, Union Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Saturday. Speaking at a private event, the minister said th... [2358 chars]

articles.title: Helping hand: Claysburg-Kimmel kicks off Mentoring for Success program
articles.description: DUNCANSVILLE – Claysburg-Kimmel School District students were encouraged to continue pursuing knowledge throughout their careers and to embrace changes in technology as part of the school’s Mentoring for Success program on Thursday. A group of 18 Claysburg students traveled to Barney Wood Golf Course to listen to four local business professionals share their success stories […]

articles.title: Dr Jitendra meets President Murmu on Diwali eve, briefs about Govt initiatives
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Oct 18: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science and Technology; Earth Sciences; and Minister of State in the Prime Minister’s Office, Department of Atomic Energy, Department of Space, Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, Dr. Jitendra Singh, today called on President of India, Draupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan to exchange Diwali greetings and brief her about recent developments and forthcoming Government initiatives under his Ministries. During the meeting, Dr. Jitendra Singh also gave an update […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
NEW DELHI, Oct 18: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science and Technology; Earth Sciences; and Minister of State in the Prime Minister’s Office, Department of Atomic Energy, Department of Space, Personnel, Pub... [2892 chars]

articles.title: IPS officer gets patent for cyber and virtual technology
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent Srinagar, Oct 18: In a historic milestone for the Police, an Indian Police Service officer Mohammad Yaseen Kichloo has become the first officer from the force to be granted a patent in the field of cyber and virtual technology. A Police statement said that the patent, titled “A System for Providing Secure Identity Authentication on Virtual Tourism Platforms and A Method of Secure Authentication Thereof” (Patent No. 572210), was officially granted on October 16 this year. “This innovation […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
Srinagar, Oct 18: In a historic milestone for the Police, an Indian Police Service officer Mohammad Yaseen Kichloo has become the first officer from the force to be granted a patent in the field of cyber and virtual technology... [921 chars]

articles.title: India’s first indigenous antibiotic ‘Nafithromycin’ effective in resistant lung infections: Dr Jitendra
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Oct 18: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology; Minister of State for Prime Minister’s Office, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Department of Atomic Energy and Department of Space, Dr. Jitendra Singh today informed that India has come out with its first indigenously developed antibiotic “Nafithromycin”, which is particularly effective in resistant lung infections, especially useful for cancer patients and poorly controlled diabetics. He said this antibiotic is the first molecule entirely conceptualized, developed […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
NEW DELHI, Oct 18: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology; Minister of State for Prime Minister’s Office, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Department of Atomic Energy and Department of Spa... [3554 chars]

articles.title: TIET hosts its Convocation-2025 ceremony
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Oct 18: The Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology (TIET) today hosted its Convocation 2025, marking a momentous occasion that honored the academic accomplishments and perseverance of its graduating students. The Convocation was graced by the esteemed presence of the Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal AP Singh, PVSM, AVSM and Sarita Singh, president, Air Force Family Welfare Association (AFFWA). In his address, Air Chief Marshal AP Singh lauded TIET’s leadership in technological innovation and its […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Oct 18: The Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology (TIET) today hosted its Convocation 2025, marking a momentous occasion that honored the academic accomplishments and perseverance of its graduating students.
The ... [1726 chars]

articles.title: POWERGRID CMD R K Tyagi conferred honorary doctorate by PEC
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Oct 18: In a moment of great pride and reverence, R K Tyagi, Chairman and Managing Director, Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (POWERGRID) was today conferred the prestigious Degree of Doctor of Science (Honoris Causa) by Punjab Engineering College (PEC), Chandigarh. The degree was conferred to Tyagi in recognition of his outstanding contributions to the growth of the power sector in India and his exemplary achievements in the fields of electrical engineering, science and technology. The […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Oct 18: In a moment of great pride and reverence, R K Tyagi, Chairman and Managing Director, Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (POWERGRID) was today conferred the prestigious Degree of Doctor of Science (Honoris C... [1236 chars]
